author: Special Correspondent
text:
Indian Coast Guard (ICG) personnel attached to Mandapam station rescued six fishermen who were in distress after seawater entered the engine room of their boat when they were fishing on Wednesday morning.

The fishermen were fishing in the middle of Pamban channel when seawater entered the engine room of the boat. ICG Cushion Hovercraft H-190, which was on patrol, rushed to the rescue of the fishermen after sighting the boat in distress, an ICG release said.

The boarding party in the hovercraft carried out deflooding, using a submersible pump, and brought the boat in safe condition. Meanwhile, Mandapam station of the ICG deployed a vessel for assistance and the fishermen were brought to the harbour with the boat, it said.
title: ICG men rescue six fishermen in distress
